title: Guangfo Metro
text:
The Guangfo Metro or Guangfo line is a intercity <a href="rapid%20transit">metro</a> line that connects the Chinese cities <a href="Foshan">Foshan</a> and <a href="Guangzhou">Guangzhou</a>. As of December 2018, the line is currently long and has 25 <a href="metro%20station">stations</a>, which are all underground.
History.
The line was expected to start <a href="construction">construction</a> in 2002 with a tentative opening in 2009. However, due to <a href="Financial%20capital">capital</a> shortage, its construction was claimed to be suspended until it resumed in 2007. The section between and was completed in 2010. The Xilang–Yangang section began operation on December 28, 2015. The section between and was completed in 2018.
Since 24 April 2016, <a href="Wi-Fi">Wi-Fi</a> is available across the entire line.
Future Development.
Guangzhou section.
The eastern extension from to Dashacundong is under planning. The extension will be 2.4 km in length.
